article: We walked in so quietly that the nurse at the desk didn t even lift her eyes from the book. Mum _ at a big chair by the door and I knew she wanted me to _ down. While I watched _ open in surprise, Mum _ her hat and coat and gave them to me to hold. She walked _ to the small room by the lift and took out a wet mop. She _ the mop past the desk and _ the nurse looked up, Mum nodded and said, Very _ floors. Yes, I m _ they ve finally decided to clean them, the nurse answered. She looked at Mum _ and said, But aren t you working late? Mum just pushed harder, each swipe of the mop _ her farther and farther down the hall. I watched _ she was out of sight and the nurse had _ to writing in the big book.After a long time Mum came back. Her eyes were _ . She quickly put the mop back and took my _ . As we turned to go out of the door, Mum bowed politely to the nurse and said, _ . Outside, Mum told me: Dogmas is _ . No fever. You saw her, Mum? Of course. I told her about the hospital _ , and she will not expect us until tomorrow. Dad will stop _ as well. It s a fine hospital. But such _ ! a mop is no good. You need a brush. 36.
